title: 112_s1780
content: The Act titled "Federal Communications Commission Consolidated Reporting Act of 2011" includes a section on a Communications Marketplace Report added to the Communications Act of 1934. The Act "Federal Communications Commission Consolidated Reporting Act of 2011" mandates the Commission to publish a report on the state of the communications marketplace every even-numbered year. The report assesses competition among various communication service providers and the deployment of communication services. The Act mandates the Commission to assess the state of deployment of communications capabilities, including advanced telecommunications capability, and to evaluate barriers to competitive entry into the communications marketplace. The Commission is required to assess the state of competition in the communications marketplace, including intermodal and facilities-based competition, and to describe its agenda for addressing challenges and opportunities in the next 2-year period. It must also report on the actions taken in pursuit of this agenda in the previous report. The Commission is mandated to assess competition in the communications marketplace, including new services like Internet-based content and communication. It must compile a list of areas lacking advanced telecommunications services and may compare the US market with international markets using available data. SEC. 3. CONSOLIDATION OF REDUNDANT REPORTS; CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The ORBIT Act Report, Satellite Competition Report, International Broadband Data Report, Status of Competition in the Market for the Delivery of Video Programming Report, and Report on Cable Industry Prices are all subject to amendments or repeals as per the Consolidation of Redundant Reports and Conforming Amendments. Amendments are made to various sections of the Communications Act of 1934 and the Telecommunications Act of 1996, including the redesignation of subsections and the elimination of certain subsections. The Triennial Report and Section 706 Report are also amended to remove specific subsections. Amendments are made to the Communications Act of 1934, including the removal of certain subsections and the redesignation of others. The State of Competitive Market Conditions for Commercial Mobile Radio Services is also addressed by striking specific sentences. Additionally, a previously eliminated annual report section is reinstated. Amendments to the Communications Act of 1934 involve removing subsections, redesignating others, and addressing competitive market conditions for commercial mobile radio services. Additionally, an outdated annual report section is reinstated. Amendments to the Communications Act of 1934 involve removing and redesignating subsections in various sections, such as section 215, 227(e), 309(j), 331(b), and 336(e). The Commission is required to annually advise Congress on the amounts collected under the program. Amendments to the Communications Act of 1934 involve removing and redesignating subsections in various sections. The Commission is required to annually advise Congress on the amounts collected under the program. In section 396, subsections (i) and (m) are removed. Section 398(b)(4) removes the third sentence. Section 624A(b)(1) updates regulations. In section 713, subsection (a) is removed by striking it. SEC. 4. EFFECT ON AUTHORITY: This Act and its amendments do not change the authority of the Federal Communications Commission.
